Description: In the 1860s the great caricaturist Daumier produced a number of drawings exploring the reactions of viewers to works of art. In this example, one of several set in a studio, the haughty, aloof artist awaits the presumably enthusiastic responses of his visitors.

Exhibitions.Textblock: Daumier 1808-1879. National Gallery of Canada, Ottawa; Musee D'Orsay, Paris; The Phillips Collection, Washington. 1999-2000.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: A Connoisseur's Portfolio: Nineteenth-century Drawings and Watercolors in the Walters Art Gallery
Exhibitions.Textblock: A Connoisseur's Portfolio: Nineteenth-century Drawings and Watercolors in the Walters Art Gallery. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1983.

Exhibitions.Textblock: The Essence of Line: French Drawings from Ingres to Degas. The Walters Art Museum, Baltimore; Baltimore Museum of Art, Baltimore; Birmingham Museum of Art, Birmingham; Tacoma Art Museum, Tacoma. 2005-2006.
Daumier: Paintings, Drawings, Sculpture, Prints. Smith College Museum of Art, Northampton. 1961.
Van Clouet to Matisse. Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen, Rotterdam; Musée de l'Orangerie, Paris; The Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. 1958-1959.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: From Ingres to Gauguin: French Nineteenth Century Paintings Owned in Maryland
Exhibitions.Textblock: From Ingres to Gauguin: French Nineteenth Century Paintings Owned in Maryland. Baltimore Museum of Art, Baltimore. 1951.
Daumier, 1808-1879. Pennsylvania Museum of Art, Philadelphia, Philadelphia. 1937.
La Caricature. École des beaux-arts, Paris, Paris. 1888.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: A Supple Brush: The Flowering of Continental Watercolors
Exhibitions.Textblock: A Supple Brush: The Flowering of Continental Watercolors. The Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore. 1979.

Exhibitions.ExhTitle: Daumier and the Art of Caricature
Exhibitions.Textblock: Daumier and the Art of Caricature. Baltimore Museum of Art, Baltimore. 1989-1990.

Inscriptions: [Signature] Lower right in brown ink: h. Daumier
Keywords: man; artist; genre; cartoon; caricature; men
Medium: black crayon with watercolor and gouache heightened with white gouache on cream, moderately thick, slightly textured wove paper
Provenance: P. Aubry, Paris, March 20, 1877, by purchase [from the artist];  Mme Aubry [date and mode of acquisition unknown];  Paul Durand-Ruel, Paris, 1895 [mode of acquisition unknown];  Cyrus J. Lawrence (1886-1910), New York [date and mode of acquisition unknown];  Cyrus J. Lawrence Sale, American Art Association, New York, January 21-22, 1910, lot 34;  Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1910, by purchase [using the alias Henry Chester];  Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Title: The Amateurs
